validate_only.description: Only validate the input, do not modify the schedule

is_private.description: Indicates whether the entry, and resulting data, are only visible to admins

next_task_time.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) the next task is scheduled for

is_active.description: Indicates whether the entry should be removed from the scheduler without removing it from the system

interval.description: Seconds between tasks, or leave blank to run once

name.description: [Required] The unique identifier used in URLs and filenames

acquisitions.description: The list of acquisitions related to the entry

callback_url.description: If given, the scheduler will POST a `TaskResult` JSON object to this URL after each task completes

created.description: The date the entry was created

relative_stop.description: Integer seconds after start to stop, or leave blank for 'never' (not valid with absolute stop)

results.description: The list of results related to the entry

stop.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) to stop, or leave blank for 'never' (not valid with relative stop)

modified.description: The date the entry was modified

start.description: UTC time (ISO 8601) to start, or leave blank for 'now'

action.description: [Required] The name of the action to be scheduled

owner.description: The name of the user who owns the entry

next_task_id.description: The id of the next task to be executed

post.description: Return NO CONTENT when input is valid but validate_only is True.

get.description:
Information on users.

Post is only available to admin users. The fields `email`, `server_url`,
`auth_token`, `has_usable_password`, and `is_admin` are only visible to
admin users. For more information on user fields, see Django's
documentation on custom user models.

server_url.description: URL of server if account belongs to a sensor manager

is_active.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

schedule_entries.description: The list of schedule entries owned by the user

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

token.description: Tokens are automatically generated for all users. You can view yours by going to your User Details view in the browsable API at `/api/v1/users/me` and looking for the `auth_token` key. Non-admin user accounts do not initially have a password and so can not log in to the browsable API. To set a password for a user (for testing purposes), an admin can do that in the Sensor Configuration Portal, but only the account's token should be stored and used for general purpose API access. Example cURL call: `curl -kLsS -H "Authorization: Token 529c30e6e04b3b546f2e073e879b75fdfa147c15" https://greyhound5.sms.internal/api/v1`
token.name: Token

info.description:
A RESTful API for controlling a SCOS-compatible sensor.

# Errors

The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the success or failure of
the API call. The body of the response will be JSON in the following format:

## 400 Bad Request (Parse Error)

```json
{
    "field_name": [
        "description of first error",
        "description of second error",
        ...
    ]
}
```

## 400 Bad Request (Protected Error)

```json
{
    "detail": "description of error",
    "protected_objects": [
        "url_to_protected_item_1",
        "url_to_protected_item_2",
        ...
    ]
}
```

## 409 Conflict (DB Integrity Error)

```json
{
    "detail": "description of error"
}
```
info.title: SCOS Sensor API
